This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=ASMI.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-01-29T17:32:26Z Emiliano.Perra 2015-01-29T17:20:50+00:00 2015-01-29T17:20:50+00:00 CFP Conference 'Encountering Perpetrators', Winchester 1-3 September 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASMI;f0ea4097.1501 Dear all With apologies for any cross-posting: The CFP below is not specifically about Italy, but I hope it can still be of interest to some list members. Emiliano Perra Call for Papers: Encountering Perpetrators of Mass Killings, Political Violence and Genocide 1-3 September 2015, University of Winchester Keynote: Prof. Donald Bloxham (University of Edinburgh) The 20th & 21st centuries have borne witness to mass killings, political violence & genocide. As we move into the new millennium the people who have orchestrated & participated in such acts remain figures of fascination & of revulsion in Western society. Yet despite this [...] Kate Hallworth 2015-01-28T14:41:40+00:00 2015-01-28T14:41:40+00:00 The Italianist Vol. 35, No. 1, February 2015 is now available online https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASMI;1b9949ab.1501 The Italianist<br>Volume: 35, Number: 1 (February 2015) Kate Hallworth 2015-01-26T15:57:56+00:00 2015-01-26T15:57:56+00:00 Italian Studies Vol. 70, No. 1, February 2015 is now available online https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASMI;73332008.1501 Italian Studies<br>Volume: 70, Number: 1 (February 2015) Young Lee 2015-01-06T20:12:14+00:00 2015-01-06T20:12:14+00:00 Table of Contents: Italian Politics (Volume 29) - Still Waiting for the Transformation https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASMI;30e81f5c.1501 Published in association with the Istituto Cattaneo, and in collaboration with the Johns Hopkins University SAIS Europe at Bologna<br><br>Dear Colleague,<br><br>We are pleased to announce that the latest volume of Italian Politics has been published by Berghahn Journals.<br><br>Since 1986, Italian Politics has described and analyzed the main political and social events of the previous year. It combines systematic archival work with analysis of changes in both public sector policies and political institutions. Each volume includes a listing of the main political events of the year as well as information on the most recent elections, party politics, and public [...] Marzia Maccaferri 2015-01-03T12:00:42+00:00 2015-01-03T12:00:42+00:00 Facing the Past: Italy and Colonial Legacy - CfP DEADLINE APPROACHING https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASMI;b8f3f60a.1501 Colonialism and National Identity, "Oltremare" between Fascism and Republic<br>CALL FOR PAPERS<br><br>Seminar 3: FACING THE PAST; ITALY AND THE COLONIAL LEGACY<br>University of Cagliari<br>2-3 July 2015<br><br>Keynote speaker: prof. SILVANA PATRIARCA<br><br>The necessity to reflect on the historiography of Italian colonialism, and re-reading it as a constitutive element of Italian history requires a critical confrontation to the traditional boundaries of interpretation and the chronological terms within which it has been developed in its first decades. Italian Workers and Contractors in the<br>City's Housebuilding Industry, 1950-1980*" by Stefano Agnoletto (Peter<br>Lang, 2014), will be launched between 7.30pm and 9.30pm on Tuesday October<br>14 at 305 Founders College, York University, Toronto.<br>The evening will feature a roundtable discussion about the book.<br><br>Book page on Facebook:<br>https://www.facebook.com/pages/The-Italians-Who-Built-Toronto/730191860381712<br><br>Stefano Agnoletto (PhD)- Economic and Social Historian<br>My Blog: http://stefanoagnoletto.wordpress.com/<br>Follow me on Academia: http://kingston.academia.edu/StefanoAgnoletto Kate Smith 2014-09-18T12:33:11+01:00 2014-09-18T12:33:11+01:00 OPEN ACCESS ISSUE: Language & History Vol. 57, No. 1 is now available online https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASMI;641fa801.1409 Language & History: Open Access Issue<br>Building the History of Language Learning and Teaching (HoLLT)<br>Volume: 57, Number: 1<br>Edited by Dr Nicola McLelland (University of Nottingham) and Dr Richard Smith (University of Warwick)<br>who are collaborating on an AHRC-funded research network project, \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdTowards a History of<br>Modern Foreign Language Teaching and Learning (MFLTL)\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd. Kate Smith 2014-09-17T11:47:45+01:00 2014-09-17T11:47:45+01:00 The Italianist special issue now online: Oral Culture in Early Modern Italy: Performance, Language, Religion https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASMI;e33e87d1.1409 The Italianist<br>Oral Culture in Early Modern Italy: Performance, Language, Religion<br>Volume: 34, Number: 3 (October 2014) Kate Smith 2014-09-15T09:34:03+01:00 2014-09-15T09:34:03+01:00 Italian Culture Vol. 32, No. 2, September 2014 is now available online https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASMI;8bf6bf0d.1409 Italian Culture<br>Volume: 32, Number: 2 (September 2014)<br>Special Issue: Machiavelli Charles Woodhead 2014-09-05T09:51:46+00:00 2014-09-05T09:51:46+00:00 Global Rome, Italoamericana & Making Italian America https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASMI;fd03159c.1409 [Description: Description: \\\\capbiz02\\images\\covers\\large\\9780253012951_FChigh.jpg]<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/global-rome>Global Rome<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/global-rome><br><br>Changing Faces of the Eternal City<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/global-rome><br>Edited by Isabella Clough Marinaro & Bj\ufffd\ufffdrn Thomassen<br>"[I]nnovative.... [T]here is no equivalent book currently available in any language.... [W]ill lend itself to semester-length courses on Rome as an 'urban laboratory.'" -John Agnew, University of California, Los Angeles<br>Is 21st-century Rome a global city? Is it part of Europe's core or periphery? This volume examines the "real city" beyond Rome's historical center, exploring the diversity and challenges of life in neighborhoods affected by immigration, neoliberalism, formal urban planning, and grassroots social movements. [...] Stefano Bellin 2014-07-10T01:49:36+01:00 2014-07-10T01:49:36+01:00 CFP Humanity and Animality Interdisciplinary Conference https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ASMI;5d94cfe8.1407 *with apologies for cross posting*<br><br>Call for papers:<br><br>University College London (UCL)<br><br>Joint Faculty Institute of Graduate Studies<br><br>*Humanity and Animality in 20th and 21st Century Culture:*<br><br>*Narratives, Theories, Histories. An Interdisciplinary Conference*<br><br>*15 September, 2014*<br><br>This interdisciplinary conference takes up an important debate in a field<br>of growing importance in the humanities, where animal studies,<br>post-humanism, and eco-criticism have surged in recent years. The<br>definition of mankind seems necessarily to pass through an understanding of<br>what constitutes the animal.
